isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Recondition - Inspect Valve Rotators and Retainers

step1.para: Clean all valve rotators and retainers in a suitable solvent.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, install rotators on intake valves.

note.para: Some low horse power engines have retainers on the exhaust valves. Rotators must be used on intake valves and can be used on exhaust valves to extend valve life.

step1.para: Inspect valve retainers and rotators for wear, deformation, cracking, or corrosion. Replace if damaged.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, suitable protection must be placed between rotator and ram of Valve and Clutch Spring Tester.

step1.para: Lubricate valve rotator with clean engine oil. Place valve spring and rotator in Valve and Clutch Spring Tester .
Place a ball bearing between the valve rotator and ram of the spring tester. The ball bearing must be large enough to prevent the ram from touching any part of the rotator.
Paint a reference line on the valve rotator and spring.
Compress valve spring rapidly with even pressure and observe the valve rotator as it turns. Replace any valve rotator that does not turn.
